> From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...] 
> 
> Berin Loritsch wrote:
> 
> >I was writing a testcase, and realized that with all the assertion 
> >methods in junit.framework.Assert, there is no assertEquals(double, 
> >double). There
> >are versions for integers, longs, shorts, chars, Obejcts, 
> etc.  Is this
> >just
> >an oversight?
> >
> 
> It's in there as:
> 
>     assertEquals(double expected, double actual, double delta);


Ah!

I was wanting to use it like:

      assertEquals(double expected, double actual);

Or would that be assertSame()?

The thing is I was testing to see if the value I put into a class was
the same I got out of a class.  There were no calculations at this
point,
where we would need to worry about the "delta" or +/- uncertainty.

BTW, is there something where we can easily test asymetrical
uncertainties?
You know, something along the lines of +.5/-.1 ?
